Key Match Events: Coby White narrowly missed his first career triple-double, finishing with 23 points, 10 rebounds and 9 assists
Torrey Craig scored 18 with five 3-pointers after halftime
Miles Bridges had 31 points, 12 rebounds and eight assists

Trailing by 3 in regulation, Bridges missed a corner 3 to tie it and Vucevic was fouled, but missed both free throws, giving Charlotte another chance. This time, Bridges connected on a leaning 3-pointer with 2 seconds left to send the game into OT.
The Bulls raced to an eight-point lead as White scored on a drive and Vucevic and Craig knocked down 3s
Patrick Williams knocked down a corner 3 off an assist from Lonzo Ball with 49 seconds left in overtime to push the Chicago lead to seven
Pre-Game Insights: LaMelo Ball missed the game due to wrist soreness. Brandon Miller (sprained ankle) also sat for the Hornets. Zach LaVine (toe soreness) and Ayo Dosunmu (soleus strain) were out for Chicago.
Post-Match Reflections: The Bulls: Craig didn't play in the first half, but was a huge spark after the break. He finished 6 of 10 from the field and 5 of 7 from 3-point range.
The Hornets: Guard Tre Mann will miss at least another two weeks with disc irritation. Mann is averaging 14.1 points off the bench, but hasn't played since Nov. 21.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Ball brothers matchup never materialized.
